item.title: Chinese cyber-espionage group Moshen Dragon targets Asian telcos
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Researchers have identified a new cluster of malicious cyber activity tracked as Moshen Dragon, targeting telecommunication service providers in Central Asia. [...]

item.title: New PyScript project lets you run Python programs in the browser
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The project was announced this weekend at PyCon US 2022 and acts as a wrapper around the Pyodide project, which loads the CPython interpreter as a WebAssembly browser module. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Defender for Business stand-alone now generally available
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says that its enterprise-grade endpoint security for small to medium-sized businesses is now generally available. [...]

item.title: Google SMTP relay service abused for sending phishing emails
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Phishing actors abuse Google's SMTP relay service to bypass email security products and successfully deliver malicious emails to targeted users. [...]

item.title: Cyberspies use IP cameras to deploy backdoors, steal Exchange emails
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A newly discovered and uncommonly stealthy Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group is breaching corporate networks to steal Exchange (on-premise and online) emails from employees involved in corporate transactions such as mergers and acquisitions. [...]

item.title: Car rental giant Sixt facing disruptions due to a cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: ​Car rental giant Sixt was hit by a weekend cyberattack causing business disruptions at customer care centers and select branch [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Windows 11 bug causing flickers in safe mode
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has addressed a newly acknowledged known issue that caused flickering screen problems and made some Windows apps (e.g., File Explorer, Start Menu, and Taskbar) seem unstable in Safe Mode without Networking. [...]

item.title: U.S. DoD tricked into paying $23.5 million to phishing actor
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice (DoJ) has announced the conviction of Sercan Oyuntur, 40, resident of California, for multiple counts relating to a phishing operation that caused $23.5 million in damages to the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD). [...]

item.title: REvil ransomware returns: New malware sample confirms gang is back
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The notorious REvil ransomware operation has returned amidst rising tensions between Russia and the USA, with new infrastructure and a modified encryptor allowing for more targeted attacks. [...]

item.title: Open source 'Package Analysis' tool finds malicious npm, PyPI packages
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: The Open Source Security Foundation (OpenSSF), a Linux Foundation-backed initiative has released its first prototype version of the 'Package Analysis' tool that aims to catch and counter malicious attacks on open source registries. the open source tool released on GitHub was able to identify over 200 malicious npm and PyPI packages. [...]

item.title: Russian hackers compromise embassy emails to target governments
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Security analysts have uncovered a recent phishing campaign from Russian hackers known as APT29 (Cozy Bear or Nobelium) targeting diplomats and government entities. [...]

item.title: A YouTuber is encouraging you to DDoS Russia—how risky is this?
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: A YouTube influencer with hundreds of thousands of subscribers is encouraging everyone to conduct cyber warfare against Russia. How risky is it and can you get in trouble? [...]

item.title: Google fights doxxing with updated personal info removal policy
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Google has expanded its policies to allow doxxing victims to remove more of their personally identifiable information (PII) from search engine results starting earlier this week. [...]
